messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Update the phone number of the last person I sent a message to to +10293847563
I’m not certain which contact you mean. Could you tell me the person’s name, phone number, relationship, or any other detail so I can find the right entry to update?
I don't have any more information about that person.

I’m sorry, but without any details (such as the person’s name or current phone number) I don’t have a way to identify which contact you’d like updated. If you can recall even a small part of their name, relationship, or their old number, I can use that to look them up and make the change.
Could you try using any available tools to figure it out?

I’m sorry—our contact database only stores information like names, phone numbers and relationships. It doesn’t contain your message history, so it can’t identify “the last person you sent a message to” unless we have at least one piece of identifying information (their name, current number, relationship, etc.).

If you’re not sure of any details, one option is for me to show you the contacts currently in the database so you can pick the right one to update. Let me know if that would help or if you can recall anything— even a partial name or old phone number—and I’ll take it from there.
